tit.e: Kyoen Kankan (the wood strip on which ancient Chinese characters are written)
Kyoen Kankan (the wood strip on which ancient Chinese characters are written)
Kyoen Kankan (the wood strip on which ancient Chinese characters are written)

sen.j: 居延漢簡（きょえんかんかん）は、中国、内モンゴル自治区エチナ旗から甘粛省酒泉の東北部にある居延烽燧遺跡から発見された前漢代・後漢代の木簡。
sen.e: Kyoen Kankan is mokkan (a narrow strip of wood on which an official message is written) of The Former Han and The Later Han periods, discovered in the Kyoen Hosui site covering from Ejin Banner of Inner Mongolia, China to the northeastern region of Jiuquan City, Gansu province, China.

Kyoen Kankan is mokkan (a narrow strip of wood on which an official message is written) of the Former Han and the Later Han periods, discovered in the Kyoen Hosui site covering from Ejin Banner of Inner Mongolia, China to the northeastern region of Jiuquan City, Gansu Province, China.

Kyoen Kankan is mokkan (a narrow strip of wood on which an official message is written) of the Former Han and the Later Han periods, discovered in the Kyoen Hosui site covering from Ejin Banner of Inner Mongolia, China to the northeastern region of Jiuquan City, Gansu Province, China.

sen.j: 歴史資料として貴重なだけでなく、書蹟としても珍重されている。
sen.e: Not only are they valuable as historical materials, but they are also prized as penmanship.
Not only are they valuable as historical materials, but they are also prized as penmanship.
Not only are they valuable as historical materials, but they are also prized as penmanship.

sen.j: 発見の経緯
sen.e: History of discovery
History of discovery
History of discovery

sen.j: 19世紀末から中国大陸では、敦煌市やチベットを中心とする西域の探検と遺蹟の発掘・調査が多くの探検家によって行われていた。
sen.e: The expedition of the western regions of China centering on Dunhuang City and Tibet as well as the excavation and research of sites have been conducted by many explorers in the Chinese continent since the end of the 19th century.

The expedition of the western regions of China centering on Dunhuang City and Tibet as well as the excavation and research of sites were conducted by many explorers in the Chinese continent since the end of the 19th century.

The expedition of the western regions of China centering on Dunhuang City and Tibet as well as the excavation and research of sites were conducted by many explorers in the Chinese continent since the end of the 19th century.

sen.j: そのような探検家の1人であったスウェーデンのスヴェン・ヘディンは、1899年頃からたびたび探検隊を組んで調査を行い、木簡などを大量に発見した実績があった。
sen.e: Sven Hedin (Swedish geographer) who was one of these explorers has often organized an expedition to conduct research since around 1899 and had a track record of discovering mokkans and so on in large amount.

Sven Hedin (Swedish geographer) who was one of these explorers often organized an expedition to conduct investigation since around 1899 and had a track record of discovering mokkans and so on in large amount.

Sven Hedin (Swedish geographer) who was one of these explorers often organized an expedition to conduct investigation since around 1899 and had a track record of discovering mokkans and so on in large amount.

sen.j: その年代は前漢代から魏晋南北朝時代までにわたったが、その数はせいぜい数百本程度であった。
sen.e: The age of mokkan ranged from The Former Han period to the Wei-Jin-Nanbeichao period, but the amount was not more than several hundreds.
The ages of mokkans ranged from the Former Han period to the Wei-Jin-Nanbeichao period, but the amount was not more than several hundreds.
sen.cmt: The→theage→ages, 上で複数形mokkanを用いているので、合わせました。
sen.e: The ages of mokkans ranged from the Former Han period to the Wei-Jin-Nanbeichao period, but the amount was not more than several hundreds.

sen.j: その中で、1930年からヘディンを団長とするスウェーデン・中国合同の「西北科学考査団」が西域入りすることになった。
sen.e: In the meantime, 'The Sino-Swedish Expedition', a joint venture of Sweden and China, under the leadership of Sven Hedin was dispatched to the western regions of China in 1930.
In the meantime, 'The Sino-Swedish Expedition', a collaboration of Sweden and China, under the leadership of Sven Hedin was dispatched to the western regions of China in 1930.
sen.cmt: 「西北科学考査団」の意味がThe Sino-Swedish Expeditionでよいのか不明です。joint venture→collaboration
sen.e: In the meantime, 'The Sino-Swedish Expedition', a collaboration of Sweden and China, under the leadership of Sven Hedin was dispatched to the western regions of China in 1930.

sen.j: 同団はゴビ砂漠を横断中、望楼の跡を発掘していたのであるが、この際に漢代の木簡が発見された。
sen.e: The expedition excavated the site of Boro (watch tower) while crossing the Gobi Desert and at that time mokkans of the Han period were discovered.
The expedition was excavating the site of Boro (watch tower) while crossing the Gobi Desert and at that time mokkans of the Han period were discovered.
sen.cmt: 時制を進行形に訂正しました。
sen.e: The expedition was excavating the site of Boro (watch tower) while crossing the Gobi Desert and at that time mokkans of the Han period were discovered.

sen.j: ここから芋づる式に木簡の発見が相次ぎ、翌1931年にかけて調査した結果、漢代のものだけ約1万枚という未曾有の量の木簡が出土するに至ったのである。
sen.e: Since then mokkan has been continuously discovered one after another, and as a result of research conducted over the following year 1931, an unprecedented number of about 10,000 mokkans which belonged only to the Han period were found.

Since then mokkan has been continuously discovered one after another, and as a result of research conducted over the following year 1931, an unprecedented number of about 10,000 mokkans which belonged only to the Han period were found.

Since then mokkans have been continuously discovered one after another, and as a result of the research conducted over the following year 1931, approximately 10,000 mokkans were found; this is an unprecedented number for those which belonged only to the Han period.

sen.j: 発見者は考古学者のフォルケ・ベリイマンである。
sen.e: The discoverer is Folke Bergman, a Swedish archaeologist.
The discoverer is Folke Bergman, a Swedish archaeologist.
The discoverer is Folke Bergman, a Swedish archaeologist.

sen.j: これらの総称が「居延漢簡」である。
sen.e: The general name for these mokkans is 'Kyoen Kankan'.
sen.cmt: The general name of these mokkans is 'Kyoen Kankan'.
sen.e: The general name of these mokkans is 'Kyoen Kankan'.
The general name of these mokkans is 'Kyoen Kankan'.

sen.j: 年代と内容
sen.e: Age and content
Age and content
Age and content

sen.j: 居延漢簡の年代は全て漢代で、前漢の武帝 (漢)が居延県を置いてから後漢中頃までに及ぶ。
sen.e: The age of Kyoen Kankan was all in the Han period and it ranges from the period when the Emperor Wu (Han) of the Former Han established Kyoen prefecture to the middle of the Later Han period.
sen.cmt: The age of Kyoen Kankan was all in the Han period and it ranges from the period when the Emperor Wu (Han) of the Former Han established Kyoen prefecture to the middle of the Later Han period.
sen.e: The ages of Kyoen Kankan were all in the Han period and it ranges from the period when the Emperor Wu (Han) of the Former Han established Kyoen Prefecture to the middle of the Later Han period.
The ages of Kyoen Kankan were all in the Han period and it ranges from the period when the Emperor Wu (Han) of the Former Han established Kyoen Prefecture to the middle of the Later Han period.

sen.j: 具体的に使われている紀年で最古のものは太初 (漢)3年（紀元前102年）、最新のものは永元 (漢)10年（98年）である。
sen.e: Specifically, the oldest one was used in B.C. 102 and the latest one in 98.
Specifically, the oldest one was used in B.C. 102 and the latest one in 98.
Specifically, the oldest one was used in B.C. 102 and the latest one in 98.

sen.j: その内容の多くは公文書で、特にこの地を警護していた張掖郡居延都尉や肩水都尉の駐屯の記録が大半であるが、一部当時の法律や医学書、暦などが含まれている。
sen.e: Many of its contents were official documents and especially most of them were the records of stationing by Choekigun Kyoen Toi (The chief of Kyoen of Choeki County) and Kensui Toi (The chief of Kensui) who guarded the area, but some of them include law, medical books, calendar and so on of the time.

Many of its contents were official documents and especially most of them were the records of stationing by Choekigun Kyoen Toi (The chief of Kyoen of Choeki County) and Kensui Toi (The chief of Kensui) who guarded the area, but some of them included law, medical books, calendar and so on of the time.

Many of its contents were official documents and especially most of them were the records of stationing by Choekigun Kyoen Toi (The chief of Kyoen of Choeki County) and Kensui Toi (The chief of Kensui) who guarded the area, but some of them included law, medical books, calendar and so on of the time.

sen.j: 歴史的評価
sen.e: Historical assessment
Historical assessment
Historical assessment

sen.j: 居延漢簡は、漢代における西域統治の実態を明らかにする第一級の史料として高く評価された。
sen.e: Kyoen Kankan was highly valued as a primary historical material which reveals the actual state of administration of the western region in the Han period.
Kyoen Kankan was highly valued as a primary historical material which revealed the actual state of administration of the western region in the Han period.
Kyoen Kankan was highly valued as a primary historical material which revealed the actual state of administration of the western region in the Han period.

sen.j: その大きな要因は、駐屯の記録が内容のほとんどを占めているということにある。
sen.e: The key factor is that most contents were the records of stationing.
The key factor is that most of the contents were the records of stationing.
The key factor is that most of the contents were the records of stationing.

sen.j: この地域は辺境の地であり、常に周囲の異民族からの脅威にさらされていた。
sen.e: This region was a border area and it was always exposed to the threat of different ethnic groups around the region.
That region was an outlying area and it was always exposed to the threat of different ethnic groups around the region.
That region was an outlying area and it was always exposed to the threat of different ethnic groups around the region.

sen.j: そのため軍事的に重要な土地であり、その記録が残されていることは、すべて当時の西域経営を直接的に物語ることになるのである。
sen.e: It was therefore the militarily important area and the fact that the records remained will directly indicate all of administration of the western region of the time.
It was therefore the militarily important area and the fact that the records remained will directly indicate all of administration of the western region of the time.
It was therefore the militarily important area and the fact that the records remained will directly indicate all of administration of the western region of the time.

sen.j: その全釈文と考証は、労（ろうかん）によって1943年に『居延漢簡考釈』としてまとめられた。
sen.e: All of transliterated documents and the study of these documents were published as "Interpretation of Kyoen Kankan" by LAO Kan in 1943.
sen.cmt: 「ろうかん」の「かん」に相当する漢字が抜けていますが、「労榦」(LAO Kan)と思われます。
sen.e: All of transliterated documents and the study of these documents were published as "Interpretation of Kyoen Kankan" by LAO Kan in 1943.
All of transliterated documents and the study of these documents were published as "Interpretation of Kyoen Kankan" by LAO Kan in 1943.

sen.j: 戦後にも1957年に中国科学院考古研究所から『居延漢簡甲編』が、1980年に中国社会科学院考古研究所から『居延漢簡甲乙編』が出版されている。
sen.e: Also after the war, "Kyoen Kankan Kohen" (The first volume of Kyoen Kankan) was published by The archaeology research institute of Chinese Academy of Social Sciences in 1957 and "Kyoen Kankan Kootsuhen" (The 2nd volume of Kyoen Kankan) by Institute of Archaeology Chinese Academy of Social Sciences in 1980.

After the war, "Kyoen Kankan Kohen" (The first volume of Kyoen Kankan) was published by the archaeology research institute of Chinese Academy of Sciences in 1957 and "Kyoen Kankan Kootsuhen" (The 2nd volume of Kyoen Kankan) by Institute of Archaeology of Chinese Academy of Social Sciences in 1980.
sen.cmt: Also消去します。The→the,中国科学院→Chinese Academy of Sciencesof追加します。
sen.e: After the war, "Kyoen Kankan Kohen" (The first volume of Kyoen Kankan) was published by the archaeology research institute of Chinese Academy of Sciences in 1957 and "Kyoen Kankan Kootsuhen" (The 2nd volume of Kyoen Kankan) by Institute of Archaeology of Chinese Academy of Social Sciences in 1980.

sen.j: また並行して発掘調査も続いており、1972年から居延考古隊がエチナ河流域の再調査を行い、1973年以降、さらに2万枚以上の木簡が発見されている（居延新簡）。
sen.e: In addition, the excavation and research have been continued in parallel, and Kyoen archaeological team started to re-examine the Ejin river area in 1972 and more than 20,000 other mokkans have been discovered since 1973 (Kyoen Shinkan).
sen.cmt: 「居延考古隊」は定訳不明です。「居延新簡（きょえんしんかん）」の定訳は不明です。読み方は以下のサイトで確認しました。http://www.nisk.jp/shodokisochishiki/shodonorekishi_07.html
sen.e: In addition, the excavation and investigation been continued in parallel, and Kyoen archaeological team started to re-examine the Ejin river area in 1972 and more than 20,000 mokkans have been discovered since 1973 (Kyoen Shinkan).

In addition, the excavation and investigation been continued in parallel, and Kyoen archaeological team started to re-examine the Ejin river area in 1972 and more than 20,000 mokkans have been discovered since 1973 (Kyoen Shinkan).

sen.j: 書的評価
sen.e: Calligraphic assessment
Calligraphic assessment
Calligraphic assessment

sen.j: 居延漢簡は書道の世界にも大きな発見をもたらした。
sen.e: Kyoen Kankan led to a great discovery in the world of Shodo (calligraphy) as well.
Kyoen Kankan led to a great discovery in the world of Shodo (calligraphy) as well.
Kyoen Kankan led to a great discovery in the world of Shodo (calligraphy) as well.

sen.j: 居延漢簡の書かれた時代は篆書から隷書へと書体が変化する時期に当たっているが、ちょうどその変化＝隷変のあった前漢代にはほとんど碑などの金石文が残されておらず、ごくわずかな書蹟から推測するだけの状態であった。
sen.e: The days when Kyoen Kankan was written correspond to the period when the calligraphic style changed from tensho (seal script) to reisho (clerical script), but very few Kinsekibun (words written on metal or stones) such as stone monument remained when such change = reihen (change in calligraphic style) occurred in the Former Han period and therefore reihen was only presumed on the basis of very small number of penmanship.

The days when Kyoen Kankan was written correspond to the period when the calligraphic style changed from tensho (seal script) to reisho (clerical script), but very few Kinsekibun (words written on metal or stones) such as stone monuments remained when such change, i.e. reihen (change in calligraphic style), occurred in the Former Han period and therefore reihen was only presumed on the basis of a very small number of penmanship.
sen.cmt: stone monumentを複数にしました。= を, that is,に訂正しました。very small number of penmanship.→a very small number of penmanship.
sen.e: The days when Kyoen Kankan was written correspond to the period when the calligraphic style changed from tensho (seal script) to reisho (clerical script), but very few Kinsekibun (words written on metal or stones) such as stone monuments remained when such change, i.e. reihen (change in calligraphic style), occurred in the Former Han period and therefore reihen was only presumed on the basis of a very small number of penmanship.

sen.j: しかし居延漢簡には純粋な篆書からはじまって、隷書になりかけた初期の隷書である「古隷」、完全な波磔（はたく、隷書独特の大きなはらい）を持つ隷書＝八分隷までこの時代考え得る移行期の書体が全て使用されており、隷変の過程が明らかになった。
sen.e: However, all possible calligraphic styles of transitional period in those days, from pure tensho (seal script), 'korei' (old clerical script) which was early reisho at the stage of changing itself to reisho to happunrei = reisho having complete hataku (horizontal lines ending in a noticeable triangular tail that were specific to reisho), were used in Kyoen Kankan and thereby the process of reihen was revealed.

However, all possible calligraphic styles of the transitional period in those days, from pure tensho (seal script), 'korei' (old clerical script) which was early reisho becoming to reisho to happunrei, i.e. reisho having complete hataku (horizontal lines ending in a noticeable triangular tail that were specific to reisho), were used in Kyoen Kankan and thereby the process of reihen was revealed.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を挿入し、＝→, i.e.に変えました。
sen.e: However, all the possible calligraphic styles of the transitional period in those days were used in Kyoen Kankan: from pure tensho (seal script), through 'korei' (old clerical script) which was early reisho (close to reisho) to reisho with complete hataku (horizontal lines ending in a noticeable triangular tail that were specific to reisho) which is called Happunrei; thereby the process of reihen was revealed.

sen.j: それまで隷変は篆書→古隷→八分隷と直線的に起こったと考えられていた。
sen.e: Until then, reihen was thought to occur in a linear manner: tensho -> korei -> happunrei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Until then, reihen was thought to occur in a linear manner: tensho, korei to happunrei.
Until then, reihen was thought to occur in a linear manner: tensho, korei to happunrei.

sen.j: しかし、居延漢簡でほぼ同時代に古隷と八分隷が混在していることから、元々八分隷は隷書の書風の一つであって、それが古隷の書法に代わり後に標準となったと結論づけられたのである。
sen.e: However, because korei and happunrei coexisted in Kyoen Kankan in almost the same period, it was concluded that happunrei has originally been one calligraphic style of reisho and it became the standard later in lieu of shoho (penmanship, calligraphy) of korei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because korei and happunrei coexisted in Kyoen Kankan in almost the same period, it was concluded that happunrei was originally one calligraphic style of reisho and it became the standard later in lieu of shoho (penmanship, calligraphy) of korei.

However, because korei and happunrei coexisted in Kyoen Kankan in almost the same period, it was concluded that happunrei was originally one calligraphic style of reisho and it became the standard later in lieu of shoho (penmanship, calligraphy) of korei.

sen.j: このような書道史上の価値もさることながら、一般民衆の手になる素朴な書風が書蹟として愛好されるようになり、現在では書作品として臨書されたり書風を模倣されたりすることも多い。
sen.e: In addition to its value in calligraphy history, its simple calligraphic style created by common people became popular as penmanship and now people often do Rinsho (writing calligraphy with copying) as works of calligraphy or imitate its calligraphic style.

In addition to its value in calligraphy history, its simple calligraphic style created by common people became popular as penmanship and now people often copy it as the work of calligraphy or imitate its calligraphic style.
sen.cmt: often do Rinsho (writing calligraphy with copying) as works of calligraphy→原文の意味を伝えるためにoften copy it as the work of calligraphyに変更しました。
sen.e: In addition to its value in calligraphy history, its simple calligraphic style created by common people became popular as penmanship and now people often copy it as the work of calligraphy or imitate its calligraphic style.

sen.j: 木簡書として一つののジャンルを形成しつつある。
sen.e: It is creating a genre as mokkan-sho (calligraphic style of mokkan).
sen.cmt: 「一つのの」は「一つの」の誤りとみなし、訂正して訳しました。
sen.e: It is creating a genre as mokkan-sho (calligraphic style of mokkan).
It is creating a genre as mokkan-sho (calligraphic style of mokkan).
